required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Brain Activities in Cervical Dystonia
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Cortical Network Activities in Cervical Dystonia

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

clinical_study.source: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

brief_summary.textblock: To address joint position sense in cervical dystonia patients and how it affects the brain activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Brain Signals Recorded via Non-Invasive Surface Electromyography

intervention.intervention_name: There will be no intervention associated with this study.
intervention.description: There will be no intervention associated with this study. It only includes recording wrist joint position discrimination threshold angle as well as recording brain signals via non-invasive surface electroencephlography.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with cervical dystonia will be recruited from the University of Minnesota's Movement Disorders Clinic.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients having cervical dystonia and aged matched healthy control group
Exclusion Criteria:
- cervical dystonia patients with severe head tremor will be excluded
